Title: How to View Log Information
Priority: J.D. Meier, Jason Taylor, Prashant Bansode, Carlos Farre, Madhu Sundararajan, Rob Boucher, Steve Gregersen

Data:
Applies to

  • Microsoft® Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) 3.5
  • Microsoft Visual Studio® 2008

Description

You can use the SvcTraceViewer.exe utility to view both message log files and trace files. You can find this tool at <Drive Name>:\Program Files\Microsoft SDKs\Windows\v6.0\Bin.

This tool gives you a comprehensive implementation of the step-by-step process of the WCF service, showing each interaction with the WCF runtime and the clients. It shows the object activities, messages, and all errors that occurred in the host’s life. It also provides you a graphical view of the log or trace data.

Additional Resources

  • For more information on using the service trace Viewer Tool, see “Service Viewer Trace Tool” at http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms732023.aspx and
    “Examining WCF Diagnostic Traces Using Service Trace Viewer Tool (SvcTraceViewer.exe)” at http://blogs.msdn.com/alikl/archive/2007/10/23/examining-wcf-diagnostic-traces-using-service-trace-viewer-tool-svctraceviewer-exe.aspx
  • For more information on authentication, see “Authentication” at http://msdn2.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms733082.aspx
